Sarah Knowles Bolton (September 15, 1841 - February 21, 1916) bụ onye edemede America
A mụrụ ya na Farmington, Connecticut
N'afọ 1866, ọ lụrụ Charles E
Bolton, onye ahịa na onye ọrụ ebere
O dere ọtụtụ akwụkwọ maka ndị nta akụkọ, ọ bụ otu n'ime ndị odeakwụkwọ mbụ nke Women's National Temperance Union, ọ bụkwa onye nchịkọta akụkọ nke Boston Congregationalist (1878-81)
Bolton gara njem afọ abụọ na Europe, na-amụ gbasara ịkekọrịta uru, agụmakwụkwọ dị elu nke ụmụ nwanyị, na ajụjụ ndị ọzọ gbasara mmekọrịta mmadụ na ibe ya
Ihe odide ya gbara ndị na-agụ akwụkwọ ume imeziwanye ụwa banyere ha site na okwukwe na ịrụsi ọrụ ike.

A mụrụ Sarah Knowles na Farmington, Connecticut, na Septemba 15, 1841, nne na nna ya bụ John Segar Knowles na Mary Elizabeth Miller Knowles.
John sitere na Henry Knowles, onye si London, England kwaga Portsmouth, Rhode Island, na 1665
Nne nne ya, Mary Carpenter, sitere na Elizabeth Jenckes, nwanne nwanyị Joseph Jenckes، Gọvanọ nke Rhode Island

Ndị nna nna ya gụnyere Nathaniel Stanley, nke Hartford, Connecticut, Lieutenant Colonel nke First Regiment na 1739; Assistant Treasurer, 1725-49; Treasurer، 1749-55, na site na Colonel William Pynchon, otu n'ime ndị 26 na-etinye Massachusetts Bay Colony, na onye guzobere Springfield, Massachusetts
Mgbe ọ dị afọ iri na asaa, ọ ghọrọ onye otu ezinụlọ nwanne nna ya, Colonel H
L
Miller, onye ọka iwu nke Hartford, onye ọbá akwụkwọ ya buru ibu bụ ihe na-atọ ụtọ, ụlọ ya bụkwa ebe ndị hụrụ agụmakwụkwọ na mmezi n'anya
Nwanne nne ya bụ onye na-agụ akwụkwọ nke ọma, na-atọ ụtọ ma na-ewu ewu na mmekọrịta mmadụ na ibe ya
N'ebe ahụ, nwa agbọghọ ahụ zutere Harriet Beecher Stowe, Lydia H
Sigourney, na ndị ọzọ dị ka ha, ndị ndụ ha bụ ihe na-akpali ya mgbe niile.
N'oge na-adịghị anya mgbe ọ gụsịrị akwụkwọ, o bipụtara obere mpịakọta, Orlean Lamar and Other Poems (New York City, 1863), akwụkwọ akụkọ New England nabatara usoro
Mgbe e mesịrị, ọ lụrụ Charles E
Bolton, onye gụsịrị akwụkwọ na Amherst College, ha wee kwaga Cleveland, Ohio
Ọ ghọrọ odeakwụkwọ mbụ nke Women's Christian Association nke obodo ahụ, na-eji ọtụtụ oge ya na-eleta ndị ogbenye
Mgbe, na 1874, agha nnwere onwe malitere na Hillsborough, Ohio, ọ bụ otu n'ime ndị mbụ malitere ọrụ ahụ ma nyere ya aka na okwu na edemede

N'oge na-adịghị anya, a họpụtara ya ka ọ bụrụ osote odeakwụkwọ nke National Woman's Christian Temperance Union, n'ihi ya, Frances Willard kwuru, sị, "Ọ debere isiokwu, paragraf na ihe ndị na-eme ka ọha na eze mara, nke mere ihe iji setịpụ usoro ọhụrụ anyị n'ihu ndị mmadụ karịa ka otu ụlọ ọrụ ọ bụla ruru n'oge ahụ"
Na arịrịọ nke ụmụ nwanyị na-adịghị akwụ ụgwọ nke mba ahụ
Bolton kwadebere akụkọ ihe mere eme nke agha ntụli aka maka Centennial temperance volume, na nke ọrụ Cleveland maka Annie Turner Wittenmyer's History of the Women's Temperance Crusade
N'oge ahụ, o bipụtara akụkọ ya nke akpọrọ "The Present Problem" (New York, 1874)
A kpọrọ ya na Boston ka ọ bụrụ otu n'ime ndị nchịkọta akụkọ nke Congregationalist, ọ gosipụtara onwe ya dị ka onye nta akụkọ nwere ike.
Bolton nọrọ afọ abụọ na mba ọzọ, n'akụkụ ụfọdụ na njem na n'akụkụ ọzọ na ọmụmụ ihe, nke ahụ bụ nleta nke abụọ ya na Europe

O mere nnyocha pụrụ iche banyere agụmakwụkwọ dị elu nke ụmụ nwanyị na mahadum Cambridge, Oxford, na ebe ndị ọzọ, na-akwadebe maka magazin ọtụtụ isiokwu na isiokwu ahụ, yana ọrụ ebere na ọgụgụ isi nke ụmụ nwanyị, yana ihe a na-eme maka enyemaka uche na omume nke ndị ọrụ ha, na-agụ akwụkwọ banyere isiokwu ahụ na nzukọ nke American Social Science Association nke e nwere na Saratoga Springs na 1883
Ọrụ ndị ọzọ Bolton bipụtara bụ, How Success is Won (Boston, 1884); Lives of Poor Bon's who Became Famous (New York, iSSsi; Girls who Becamed Famous) (New York
1886); Stories from Life (New York; Social Studies in England (Boston
18861; From Heart and Nature, Poems (New York)
1887); Famous American States (New York City, 1891); Famouses, Women's (New York) (Nework)
E bipụtaghachiri ọtụtụ n'ime akwụkwọ ndị a n'England.
N'agbata afọ 1863 na 1902, Bolton dere ọtụtụ uri, akwụkwọ ụmụaka na akụkọ ndụ, gụnyere:
Korean Lamar and others poems (new York 1863)
The present problem a novellete (1874)
How success is won (Boston 1884)
Lives of poor boys who became famous (New York 1885)
Lives of girls who became famous (1886)
Social studies in England (Boston 1886)
Stories from life (New York 1886)
Famous European artists (New York 1890)
Famous voyages and explorers (New York 1893)
Famous leaders among men (New York 1894)
The inevitable and other poems (New York 1895)
